metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9654 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Regular Expressions package in International Components for Unicode(ICU) for C/C++ before 2014-12-03, as used in Google Chrome before40.0.2214.91, calculates certain values without ensuring that they can berepresented in a 24-bit field, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted string, a related issue to CVE-2014-7923.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libicu52 - 52.1-3ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: icu package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.1-3ubuntu0.2').
